s3_secret_key.Description: AWS Secret Key of an account with the required permissions to post logs. It is **strongly** recommended you create a separate IAM user with permissions to only operate on this Bucket. This secret will be not be encrypted. You can provide this secret via an environment variable, `FASTLY_S3_SECRET_KEY`

server_side_encryption.Description: Specify what type of server side encryption should be used. Can be either `AES256` or `aws:kms`

server_side_encryption_kms_key_id.Description: Optional server-side KMS Key Id. Must be set if server_side_encryption is set to `aws:kms`

content.Description: The VCL code that specifies exactly what the snippet does

name.Description: A name that is unique across "regular" and "dynamic" VCL Snippet configuration blocks. It is important to note that changing this attribute will delete and recreate the resource

priority.Description: Priority determines the ordering for multiple snippets. Lower numbers execute first. Defaults to `100`

type.Description: The location in generated VCL where the snippet should be placed (can be one of `init`, `recv`, `hit`, `miss`, `pass`, `fetch`, `error`, `deliver`, `log` or `none`)

format.Description: Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting (default: `%h %l %u %t "%r" %>s %b`)

format_version.Description: The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either 1 or 2. (default: 2)

name.Description: A unique name to identify the Splunk endpoint. It is important to note that changing this attribute will delete and recreate the resource

placement.Description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed

response_condition.Description: The name of the condition to apply

tls_ca_cert.Description: A secure certificate to authenticate the server with. Must be in PEM format. You can provide this certificate via an environment variable, `FASTLY_SPLUNK_CA_CERT`

tls_client_cert.Description: The client certificate used to make authenticated requests. Must be in PEM format.

tls_client_key.Description: The client private key used to make authenticated requests. Must be in PEM format.

tls_hostname.Description: The hostname used to verify the server's certificate. It can either be the Common Name or a Subject Alternative Name (SAN)

token.Description: The Splunk token to be used for authentication

url.Description: The Splunk URL to stream logs to

message_type.Description: How the message should be formatted; one of: `classic`, `loggly`, `logplex` or `blank`. Default `classic`. See [Fastly's Documentation on Sumologic](https://developer.fastly.com/reference/api/logging/sumologic/)

name.Description: A unique name to identify this Sumologic endpoint. It is important to note that changing this attribute will delete and recreate the resource

placement.Description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed.

response_condition.Description: Name of blockAttributes condition to apply this logging.

disabled.Description: A flag used to completely disable a Web Application Firewall. This is intended to only be used in an emergency

prefetch_condition.Description: The `condition` to determine which requests will be run past your Fastly WAF. This `condition` must be of type `PREFETCH`. For detailed information about Conditionals, see [Fastly's Documentation on Conditionals](https://docs.fastly.com/en/guides/using-conditions)

response_object.Description: The name of the response object used by the Web Application Firewall

allowed_methods.Description: A space-separated list of HTTP method names

arg_length.Description: The maximum number of arguments allowed

combined_file_sizes.Description: The maximum allowed size of all files

critical_anomaly_score.Description: Score value to add for critical anomalies

error_anomaly_score.Description: Score value to add for error anomalies

high_risk_country_codes.Description: A space-separated list of country codes in ISO 3166-1 (two-letter) format

max_file_size.Description: The maximum allowed file size, in bytes

max_num_args.Description: The maximum number of arguments allowed

notice_anomaly_score.Description: Score value to add for notice anomalies

restricted_headers.Description: A space-separated list of allowed header names

modsec_rule_id.Description: The Web Application Firewall rule's modsecurity ID

exclusion_type.Description: The type of rule exclusion. Values are `rule` to exclude the specified rule(s), or `waf` to disable the Web Application Firewall

total_arg_length.Description: The maximum size of argument names and values

warning_anomaly_score.Description: Score value to add for warning anomalies
